your piece for mounting to your dowel video tutorials top border https //youtu be/hfgueerkxco scalloped border https //youtube com/shorts/2hzfqhsbzey steam block optional this is a good time to steam block your piece if you plan to do so steam blocking is a technique that uses hot steam to relax stitches and improve the shape of a crochet project i highly recommend blocking your piece before mounting to your dowel to ensure that your piece has a nice shape here are the general instructions for steam blocking 1 pin your piece to a foam blocking mat into the desired shape using blocking pins it s helpful to use a mat that has grid lines so that you can ensure that each side of your piece is consistent in length 2 using a fabric steamer hold the steam about 1-2 inches away from the piece and slowly wave back and forth steam the project for about 30- 60 seconds 3 let the piece cool for about 30 minutes or until dry then unpin from the blocking mat video tutorial pictured is my mushroom bottle pattern in the process of blocking this pattern is available on my steam blocking method etsy ravelry & ko-fi https //youtube com/shorts/5qui5wm1rzs © 2025 earth hand & fiber page 8
